citation.article-title: Nocardiopsis kunsanensis sp. nov., a moderately halophilic actinomycete isolated from a saltern.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardiopsis kunsanensis sp. nov.
Nocardiopsis kunsanensis (kun.sa.nen'sis. M.L. adj. kunsanensis pertaining to Kunsan, a location in Korea where the species was isolated)
Gram-positive, non-acid-fast, filamentous, catalase-positive and strictly aerobic.
Substrate mycelia are yellow and bear white aerial mycelia, which fragment into elongated non-motile spores with smooth surfaces.
Fragmentation of substrate mycelia does not occur.
Grows optimally at 37 °C and at pH 9 with 10% NaCl.
Does not grow onCMwith 0 or 25% NaCl, nor at pH 5.
Unable to reduce nitrate to nitrite.

Utilizes D-glucose and sucrose as sole carbon source, but not acetate, cellobiose, D-galactose, gluconate, phydroxybenzoate, myo-inositol, maltose, mannitol, paraffin, raffinose, L-rhamnose or trehalose.
Utilizes L-alanine, but not gelatin, proline or serine as sole carbon and nitrogen sources.
Degrades adenine, casein, starch, hypoxanthine, tyrosine, xanthine, gelatin and urea, but not aesculin.
Resistant to sodium azide (0.01%), crystal violet (0.0001%) and potassium tellurite (0.0001%), but not phenol (0.1%).

Contains meso-diaminopimelic acid, no diagnostic sugars, hexaor octa-hydrogenated menaquinones with 10 isoprene units, straight-chain saturated or monounsaturated, iso-, anteiso-, 10-methyl branched fatty acids with 13-18 carbons, and phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol (phospholipid type III).
The G+­C content of the DNA is 71 mol%.
The species was isolated from a saltern sample collected from Kunsan, Republic of Korea.
The type and only strain of Nocardiopsis kunsanensis is strain HA-9T (=KCTC 9831T=JCM 10721T).
